title: Circular sector
summary: A circular sector, also known as circle sector or disk sector (symbol: ⌔), is the portion of a disk (a closed region bounded by a circle) enclosed by two radii and an arc, where the smaller area is known as the minor sector and the larger being the major sector.[1] In the diagram, θ is the central angle, r {\displaystyle r} the radius of the circle, and L {\displaystyle L} is the arc length of the minor sector.
